title: 18 months for Halfmoon man who set pit bull on fire
content: The 20-year-old Halfmoon man who intentionally burned a friend’s young pit bull with alcohol was sentenced to state prison time during an appearance in Saratoga County Court Friday. Scott M. Cusson Jr. was sentenced to 18 months in prison by County Court Judge James A. Murphy III, after earlier pleading guilty to one count of felony aggravated cruelty to animals — the “Buster’s Law” authored by local state Assemblyman James Tedisco, R-Glenville.
